properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

methods.name: getFirst
methods.description: Gets the first comment in the collection. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this collection is empty.

methods.name: getFirstOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the first comment in the collection. If the collection is empty, returns an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties*](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). Returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CommentCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. Shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch and you get an "InvalidObjectPath" error, add the object to the tracked object collection when first created. If this object is part of a collection, also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object if previously tracked. Shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so free any objects you add once you're done using them. Call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
